When you do this, you should use a comma in the screenreader text before &quot;spelled.&quot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br /><br /><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>Here<span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">, spelled h e r e.</span><br /><br />Here<span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">, spelled h e r e,</span> is an alligator.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>When you add a screenreader only sentence after a visible sentence, leave a non-screenreader space between the visible sentence and the screenreader sentence to avoid reading the visible period as &quot;dot.&quot;<br /><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-orangetimesph\" style=\"color:#F79A1F;font-weight:bold;\">x</span> Here is my visible sentence.<span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\"> Here is a screenreader sentence.</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-greencheckph\" style=\"color:#08A47D;font-weight:bold;\"><span class=\"ju-orangetimesph\">v</span></span> Here is my visible sentence. <span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">Here is a screenreader sentence.</span></p>","headerText":"Screenreader text after sentences"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>In interactions,&nbsp; if you use a period at the beginning of a screenreader only phrase it set it off, NVDA will read it as &quot;dot.&quot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To address this try using a comma instead.&nbsp; There doesn&#39;t seem to be any other solution.<br /><br /><br />&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>Here<span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">.&nbsp;Spelled h e r e</span></p>","headerText":"Screenreader only periods can be tricky"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>The JUICE convention is to have 2 character spaces at the end of sentences.&nbsp; In order to have 2 character spaces between sentences,one of them is an &amp;nbsp;.&nbsp; The editor does this automatically.<br /><br />However, inserting screenreader text between existing sentences can remove the &amp;nbsp; and hence the extra space.&nbsp; To avoid this:<br /><br />1.&nbsp; Put the cursor<strong> right next to</strong> the first word of the second sentence<br /><br />2.&nbsp; Type the text you want and follow it with a space.<br /><br />3.&nbsp; Highlight from the beginning of the screenreader text and include the trailing space.</p><p><br />This will retain the spacing.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>Here is a sentence.&nbsp; <span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">The spacing looks great. </span>Here is another sentence.</p>","headerText":"Inserting screenreader text of any kind between JUICE sentences"}],"overviewHeader":"Overview"}
